Class Kubernetes

java.lang.Object
com.github.cowwoc.digitalocean.resource.Kubernetes
public final class Kubernetes extends Object
A Kubernetes cluster.

  • Method Details

    • getAll

      public static Set<Kubernetes> getAll(DigitalOceanClient client) throws IOException, InterruptedException, TimeoutException
      Returns all the clusters.
      Parameters:
      client - the client configuration
      Returns:
      an empty set if no match is found
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if client is null
      IllegalStateException - if the client is closed
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs. These errors are typically transient, and retrying the request may resolve the issue.
      TimeoutException - if the request times out before receiving a response. This might indicate network latency or server overload.
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for a response. This can happen due to shutdown signals.

    • getByPredicate

      public static Kubernetes getByPredicate(DigitalOceanClient client, Predicate<Kubernetes> predicate) throws IOException, TimeoutException, InterruptedException
      Returns the first cluster type that matches a predicate.
      Parameters:
      client - the client configuration
      predicate - the name
      Returns:
      null if no match is found
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any of the arguments are null
      IllegalStateException - if the client is closed
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs. These errors are typically transient, and retrying the request may resolve the issue.
      TimeoutException - if the request times out before receiving a response. This might indicate network latency or server overload.
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for a response. This can happen due to shutdown signals.

    • creator

      public static KubernetesCreator creator(DigitalOceanClient client, String name, Zone.Id zone, KubernetesVersion version, Set<KubernetesCreator.NodePool> nodePools)
      Creates a new cluster.
      Parameters:
      client - the client configuration
      name - the name of the node pool
      zone - the zone that the droplet is deployed in
      version - the version of Kubernetes software
      nodePools - the node pools that are deployed in the cluster
      Returns:
      a new cluster creator
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any of the arguments are null
      IllegalArgumentException - if any of the arguments contain leading or trailing whitespace or are empty

    • getIpv4

      public String getIpv4()
      Returns the public IPv4 address of the Kubernetes control plane. This value will not be set if high availability is configured on the cluster.
      Returns:
      an empty string if not set

      Determines if the cluster will be automatically upgraded to new patch releases during its maintenance window.
      Returns:

      Returns:

      Returns:

      Returns:
      true if the cluster has access

    • matches

      public boolean matches(KubernetesCreator state)
      Determines if the cluster matches the desired state.
      Parameters:
      state - the desired state
      Returns:
      true if the droplet matches the desired state; otherwise, false
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if state is null

    • update

      public void update(KubernetesCreator target) throws IOException, TimeoutException, InterruptedException, KubernetesNotFoundException
      Updates the cluster to the desired configuration.
      Parameters:
      target - the desired state
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if target is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if the server does not support applying any of the desired changes
      IllegalStateException - if the client is closed
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs. These errors are typically transient, and retrying the request may resolve the issue.
      TimeoutException - if the request times out before receiving a response. This might indicate network latency or server overload.
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for a response. This can happen due to shutdown signals.
      KubernetesNotFoundException - if the cluster could not be found
      See Also:
      • KubernetesCreator.copyUnchangeablePropertiesFrom(Kubernetes)

    • getKubeConfig

      public String getKubeConfig(Duration duration) throws IOException, TimeoutException, InterruptedException, KubernetesNotFoundException
      Downloads the kubeconfig file for this cluster. If the cluster supports token-based authentication, the provided duration specifies the token's lifetime before expiration.
      Parameters:
      duration - the lifetime of the authentication token
      Returns:
      the kubeconfig file
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if duration is null
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs. These errors are typically transient, and retrying the request may resolve the issue.
      TimeoutException - if the request times out before receiving a response. This might indicate network latency or server overload.
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for a response. This can happen due to shutdown signals.
      KubernetesNotFoundException - if the cluster could not be found

    • waitFor

      public Kubernetes waitFor(Kubernetes.State state, Duration timeout) throws IOException, TimeoutException, InterruptedException, KubernetesNotFoundException
      Blocks until the cluster reaches the desired state or a timeout occurs.
      Parameters:
      state - the desired state
      timeout - the maximum amount of time to wait
      Returns:
      the updated cluster
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if state is null
      IllegalStateException - if the client is closed
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs. These errors are typically transient, and retrying the request may resolve the issue.
      TimeoutException - if the operation times out before the cluster reaches the desired status. This might indicate network latency or server overload.
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for a response. This can happen due to shutdown signals.
      KubernetesNotFoundException - if the cluster could not be found
      See Also:
      • waitForDestroy(Duration)

    • destroyRecursively

      public void destroyRecursively() throws IOException, TimeoutException, InterruptedException
      Destroys the cluster and all of its associated resources.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the client is closed
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs. These errors are typically transient, and retrying the request may resolve the issue.
      TimeoutException - if the request times out before receiving a response. This might indicate network latency or server overload.
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for a response. This can happen due to shutdown signals.

    • waitForDestroy

      public void waitForDestroy(Duration timeout) throws IOException, TimeoutException, InterruptedException
      Blocks until the cluster is destroyed.
      Parameters:
      timeout - the maximum amount of time to wait
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if state is null
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs. These errors are typically transient, and retrying the request may resolve the issue.
      TimeoutException - if the operation times out before the cluster reaches the desired status. This might indicate network latency or server overload.
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for a response. This can happen due to shutdown signals.
